revised_title: Annual Report and Scientific Developments of the Royal Society
tldr: The report covers the Royal Society's activities, including the establishment of new premises, the resignation of Dr. Sharpey as Secretary, and the Society's involvement in various scientific projects such as gravitational astronomy, tide-gauge on Heligoland, and the International Commission for the establishment of the metric system. The report also highlights significant scientific papers published during the year, including Sir Edward Sabine's work on magnetic elements in the northern regions of the globe.
